definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
palanquin with eight carriers/(fig.) lavish treatment
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
